City Hall - City of San Saba, Texas



[Skip to content](https://sansabatexas.com/city-hall/#main)


Boil Water Notice Rescinded 1/28/26

City Alerts

**The City of San Saba is proud to announce that the Boil Water Notice posted on 1/26/26 has been rescinded.**

**[Read Boil Water Rescind Report in Its Entirety](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/BWNR-1.28.26-Rescinded.pdf)➔**

Flood 2025 Resources

City Alerts

**Resources for Flood 2025 Recovery**, **including Rebuilding Requirements and our updated Flood Damage Ordinance, are readily available for your review.**

[**View All Available Documents No**w](https://sansabatexas.com/city-services/flood-2025-info/)➔

City Hall
=========

Seat of Local Government
------------------------

City Hall is the chief administrative building for San Saba. It houses the city council, its associated departments, and their employees. It also functions as the base of the mayor of the city.

![](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/cityhall_more-1-1024x768.jpg)

The building adjacent to City Hall houses the City Chambers where the City Council holds its meetings, as well as all Boards & Commissions meetings.

### Working Together for the Good of San Saba

City Hall is a team effort staffed with dedicated administrators, department directors, and supervisors that are proud to serve and provide for the needs of the community.

Located at 303 S. Clear Street, City Hall’s hours of operation are Monday-Thursday, 7:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., and Friday, 7:30 a.m. until 11:30 a.m.
